medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe early-onset obesity with major hyperphagia and delayed puberty.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was referred to a pediatric hospital at 3.5 years of age due to extreme obesity, which began after normal weight at birth and rapidly escalated to a max weight of 180 kg at 17 years old. The patient's infancy was marked by uncontrolled appetite. Two gastroplasty procedures were performed at ages 16 and 18, leading to partial weight loss.
medical_history.past_medical_history: He has a homozygous mutation in the LEPR gene, associated with severe obesity, hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, and delayed puberty. Surgical interventions for weight loss were conducted.
medical_history.family_history: The patient is the first offspring of 6 healthy siblings from healthy parents. Family genetic analysis showed carriers of the LEPR mutation in the father and two sisters.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was compliant with dietary and physical activity counseling. There are no mentions of smoking, alcohol, or drug use.
